column4: I'm looking for a bit of information regarding the way Ubuntu 8.10 handles Xorg now, In previous versions getting Dual Screen setup as 2 X Sessions, it was as simple as commenting out Xinerama, now with no config, even setting it to false gives me no joy
most except the MultiHead section, no real references to Xinerama
How are you trying to disable xinerama?
before it was a case of commenting out the Xineram line, I have tried manually setting up the Xorg.conf and adding
after adding that to the server layout, you restarted X and /var/log/Xorg.0.log still says it loaded xinerama?
Correct, display was across both screen as opposed to 2 seperate
erm, ServerFlags apparently is what you want to add it to?
the log explicitly stated that xinerama was being loaded?
yeah same thing here, but it recognizes the option in the log too
i'll just give it a shot and see what the log says, should be Option "Xinerama" "0" to disable?
yeah, that's what it /should/ be afaict, but it seems to still load here.  See what happens though
I'll just have a read for the log, only got clone currently
